page.title: 11ST LAWRENCE CHURCH, SNAITH
page.content: The church originated in the twelfth century. Records show that over 25000 people are buried in the graveyard and surrounding Market Place. The church has an embattled western tower with pinnacles, a south porch,nave and transepts. The bells were cast in 1778. Some people say that the church is haunted. The statue near the door of Lord Downe was supposed to have come to life. In one part of the church, ( East side as you enter) there little carvings of mice on the woodwork. The most notable monuments are those relating to Sir John Dawnay (1493), Lady Elizabeth Stapylton (1688) and Viscount Downe (1837). Viscount Downe has had a new nose recently.
